timeline.bodyText: Do we need to check whether there is a current CONTEXT_SERVER_SPAN_KEY to prevent duplicate server spans here?
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: It was @trask wish to never return null from startSpan methods. And to let every instrumentation to check the existence of the server span themselves. Unfortunately :) I saw his point, so couldn't object too much.
replies.author: iNikem

timeline.author: trask

timeline.bodyText: there's several of call sites that pass 500, maybe an overload that defaults to 500?
timeline.author: trask

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * Returns context stored to the given storage by {@link #attachServerSpanContext(Context,
          
          
            
               * STORAGE)}.
          
          
            
               * Returns context stored to the given request-response-loop storage by {@link #attachServerSpanContext(Context,
          
          
            
               * STORAGE)}.
timeline.author: trask
trask
trask
trask

timeline.bodyText: can merge inner try/catch into the outer try-with-resources (and i think same in v4_0 and v4_1 copies)
timeline.author: trask
trask

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -44,10 +45,10 @@
    * io.opentelemetry.auto.instrumentation.ratpack.server.TracingHandler, so if this changes, that
    * must also change.
    */
-  // TODO understand and change to context
-  public static final AttributeKey<Span> SERVER_ATTRIBUTE_KEY =
+  public static final AttributeKey<Context> SERVER_ATTRIBUTE_KEY =
       attributeKey(HttpServerTracingHandler.class.getName() + ".span");

timeline.bodyText: i think all these server helpers can go away
timeline.author: trask

replies.bodyText: Why? From class loading perspective they don't differ from old decorator, do they?
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: A, I see what you mean... Let me try
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: Nope, they cannot. ChannelFutureListenerInstrumentation uses AttributeKeys, which depends on HttpServerTracingHandler
replies.author: iNikem

timeline.bodyText: i think this is a good catch, it seems to me this instrumentation only applies to netty client, should we move it to the client subpackage?
timeline.author: trask
trask
trask

replies.bodyText: I can rename attach method because it is protected, but getServerSpanContext is public, meant to be used by instrumentations. And I think there the longer, more explicit name, is better.
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: what do u think of  attachServerContext() and getServerContext()?
replies.author: trask
